;;"One Hundred Years, Many People, Many Things: Yang Yi's Oral Autobiography", spoken by Yang Yi, written by Yu Bin , Yilin Publishing House, January 2023;

;

;The family described by Yang Yi is very similar to Ba Jin's novel "Home", but when I was in junior high school, I disliked Ba Jin's novel very much. The style of writing is so sentimental! Yang Yi's calm narrative moved me very much while reading it. As for why Balao's novel was so popular back then, it may be that there were many young people from big families who had the same experience as the protagonist in "Family", and they were particularly easy to relate to. We must use realistic memoirs to understand the true state of people's lives at that time.

;

;;

;

;;"Collection of Explorations of Recent People and Recent Events", Chen Xiaoping, Nanjing University Press, August 2022;

;

;A textual research collection of modern history, the author is good at using archival document analysis , and field surveys to examine historical facts that were ignored or misunderstood in the past. His historical knowledge also has a strong flavor of the South China School, which pays special attention to the local perspective, thus correcting the one-dimensional perspective in the past.

;

;;

;

;;"The Great Rebellion: Group Portraits of Death and Life", [Japan] written by Nobuho Tanaka, translated by Zang Zhijun, Shanghai Translation Publishing House, November 2023;

;

;This book contains It tells the historical tracing of the "Great Rebellion" in the Meiji era and the story of the parties and their relatives striving to redress the injustice. In the long history, unjust cases of individuals and even groups are insignificant, and many people will not live to see the day when history reverses the verdict! So what is the meaning of history itself? One cannot help but ask the same question as Shi Qian: "What if the so-called way of heaven is evil or not?" What is touching is that although ninety years have passed and the parties involved are no longer alive, there are still people working hard to restore the historical truth. This effort It seems insignificant in the face of power, but it is a flickering light that illuminates the long and dark historical process.

;

;;

;

;;"Critical Biography of Lu Zhengxiang", written by Tang Qihua, Social Science Literature Press, April 2023;

;

;Based on a large number of surveys of archives at home and abroad, this book re-draws the story of the late Qing Dynasty The life of Lu Zhengxiang, the first generation of professional diplomat in the early Republic of China, also clarified many false accusations against him. It was said that a weak country had no diplomacy. It was indeed not easy to achieve some achievements in diplomacy in the early Republic of China. Most of the diplomats of that generation came from poor families. After graduating from translation schools, they were immediately sent overseas to serve as translators in embassies and consulates. After going abroad, Lu Zhengxiang studied diplomacy with the enlightened diplomat Xu Jingcheng. Xu was later executed for opposing Empress Dowager Cixi's declaration of war on the eight countries. Lu Zhengxiang himself is extremely Westernized. Not only did he learn Western languages, customs, and systems from an early age, he even married a Belgian woman who was 16 years older than him, despite everyone's opposition. The research on Lu's situation in his later years is also a highlight of this book. In his later years, Lu Zhengxiang went to Europe to treat his wife's illness and served as the Swiss minister. However, he was caught up in the troubled times in Beiyang and owed the embassy wages and fees for more than two years. As a result, after his wife died, he had no way to support him. He became more committed to Catholicism, and by chance, he stayed in a monastery. He became a monk and became a priest, completely completing the Westernization of his life.

;

;;

;

;;"As if I were here in person: Imperial Portrait Worship and Political Life in the Song Dynasty", written by Huang Bo, Shanxi People's Publishing House, January 2023;

;

;A good topic selection is equivalent to a successful project Halfway through, Huang Bo used his spare time from research to write this popular book on the history of the Song Dynasty. He took a unique approach and analyzed the political life of the Song Dynasty from the perspective of the worship of portraits of emperors in the Song Dynasty. He skillfully used historical materials and used popular and humorous language to examine the people of the Song Dynasty in the pre-nation-state era. How to use imperial portraits to create a national (sovereignty) image takes into account both academic innovation and the readability of the work.

;

;;

;

;;"Galicia: History and Imagination in Habsburg Political Culture", [American] written by Larry Wolfe, translated by Zheng Xinhe, Social Science Literature Press, January 2023;

;

;This book traces the history of a country that has passed away but still lives in people's memory. Although Galicia was an Eastern European provincial administrative region created by the Habsburg dynasty in the 18th century, the Habsburgs used the spirit of Enlightenment to reconstruct this multi-ethnic and multi-religious region, striving to create a diverse It is a dynastic autonomous territory with cultural and multi-ethnic coexistence, and has promoted the process of regional autonomy following wave after wave of revolutionary waves. However, all this came to an end with the collapse of the Habsburg dynasty in World War I. After that, Galicia had an ill-fated fate and experienced periods such as its return to Poland and Soviet occupation. However, an imaginary Galician country The construction of memory has been passed down into the 21st century, and returned to people's vision after Ukraine's independence, recalling Galicia as a fantasy paradise. Wolfe uses a large number of historical documents and even descriptions from many contemporary literary works to make this book have the rigor of historical research and the tension of literary imagination, triggering our thinking about the monster of the modern nation-state and what it is. The identity of the nation-state? Why does this concept bring hatred and division between groups in practice?

;

;;

;

;;"Learning to "Quarrel" with Chizuru Ueno at Tokyo University", [Japanese] Haruka Yoko, translated by Lu Lingzhi, Beijing United Publishing Company, March 2023;

;

;This The book is a record of a female variety show talk show artist studying with Chizuru Ueno. The writing is interesting and vivid, full of liveness and presence, and also shows the thinking process. It is interesting and profound, and it can stimulate the spark of thought. This book: "Why do you need to read a lot of documents to study? Because a vacuum of information will not produce originality." "What should you do if you can't remember the documents? Then try to forget it! What you can remember in the end is really valuable." Even more exciting I was surprised that this book was published in Japan over twenty years ago! But when I read it today, it didn’t feel outdated at all!

;

;;

;

;;"Art Can Group: Yaji in Song Dynasty Paintings", written by Gu Qing, Liaoning Fine Arts Publishing House, January 2023;

;

;"Yaji" is a bachelor of letters in ancient China The "carnival" of the "Carnival" often left poems and paintings as souvenirs. Today's calligraphy and painting circles still follow this tradition. This book originated from an elegant gathering at Tsinghua Garden Shengyinyuan in the autumn of 2015. The young scholar Gu Qing "wrote the elegant collection because of the elegant gathering" and left this research work of the elegant gathering as a commemoration of the elegant gathering. It is also a good story in the contemporary art world. What is even more rare is that in the book, Gu Qing systematically analyzes the characteristics of paintings related to elegant gatherings in Song Dynasty paintings, revealing the internal and external relationships, memorial concepts, model circulation, political affairs and leisure, "portraits" and "records" of elegant gatherings. The five distinctive features such as "prosperity" illustrate the profound connotation and the characteristics of the spread and evolution of Yaji Tu. It also puts forward many new insights, which are refreshing.

;

;;

;

;;"Modern Dream II: Designing Daily Life in Twentieth-Century Japan", [Japanese] Naojingwang, translated by Luo Yuan and Cai Huiying, Social Science Literature Press, November 2023;

;

;Takehisa Yumeji's life is full of legends, but this book is a pure art commentary and does not involve any gossip about Yumeji's private life. The book comprehensively analyzes Yumeji's achievements as a popular illustrator and graphic artist in the Taisho era. It also shows Yumeji's unique artistic connotation based on different historical stages, from the Meiji socialist trend of thought, the Great Rebellion to the Great Kanto Earthquake. , the close relationship between skills and times. The author points out that Yumeji's creations not only embody the image of Japanese women in the "Yumeji style" and "mono-sorrow", but also represent the trendy and fashionable aspects of consumerist culture guided by the mass media. There is also a sympathy for the weak that runs through Yumeji's life. and strong anti-war ideas. The appendix contains the complete newspaper series "Tokyo Disaster Illustrated Letters" created by Yumeji during the Great Kanto Earthquake, which is of great appreciation value.

;

;;

;

;;"The Key to Power: A History of World Taxation", [English] written by Dominic Frisby, translated by Liu Shengxiao, Zhejiang People's Publishing House, October 2022;

;

;This is An introductory popular book, the author believes that the history of mankind's struggle for freedom is a history of resistance to taxation. Fiscal reform shaped modern society and enabled Britain to take the lead in entering the ranks of modern countries. The second half of the book has a future outlook. It is believed that the development of Internet finance, the rise of digital nomads, and the prevalence of cryptocurrency will make it increasingly difficult for the country to collect taxes, and the maximization of digital nomads will make the nation-state model Bankruptcy. However, the battle between collection and counter-collection will continue, and technological means will enhance the ability to collect taxes in ways that invade privacy.

;

;Mayday "I really want to see you in concert". Image source: Believe Music official Weibo.

;

;In December 2023, the pop rock band "Mayday", which has been in the industry for 26 years, was involved in a lip-synching controversy at a concert.

;

;The blogger "Wheatfield Farmer" compared the vocals and song track lines at Mayday's Shanghai concert, and pointed out that 5 of the 12 songs performed by Mayday were lip-syncing.

;

;On December 4, Mayday’s management company Believe Music responded: There is no lip-synching and a statement will be issued. The concert audio has been submitted to the inspection department, and the relevant departments will conduct scientific evaluation and analysis and publish the investigation results. As of press time, there is no clear result on whether it was "lip-syncing".

;

;Ding Dang, Liu Ruoying and other artists affiliated with Believe Music all expressed their voices for Mayday on Weibo.

;

;On Zhihu, some Mayday fans mentioned that lip-synching is not new this year, it was discovered in 2019. Mayday lead singer Ashin (Chen Xinhong) also took a blockade injection for a performance, which caused many fans to feel "heartbroken" and repeatedly called on them to hold less concerts.

;

;In 2023, 48-year-old Ashin said at a concert in Chengdu, "Some people say that music treats Mayday as a cash cow. If Mayday doesn't want to sing, no one can force us. If Monster, Martha, Shitou, Guanyou, and Ashin want to sing, and no one can stop us." Today, the five members are all between 46 and 50 years old.

;

;From 20 shows a year to 60 shows a year

;

;Mayday can be said to be an indelible imprint of youth in the hearts of a generation, and this sentiment has become the driving force behind its concert box office market. Appeal.

;

;In 2023, Mayday held 6 concerts with 40,000 people at the Beijing Bird's Nest with the dual themes of "I Want to See You So Much" and "Noah's Ark 10th Anniversary Evolution Reissue Limited Edition"; Guangzhou Olympic Stadium There were 5 concerts, attracting 175,000 people; 8 concerts in Shanghai, the total audience exceeded 360,000.

;

;In other words, Mayday held 19 concerts in Beijing, Shanghai and Guangzhou this year, with an audience of about 700,000.

;

;Tickets for the Shanghai concert ranged from 355 yuan to 1,855 yuan each. They were sold out as soon as they opened, and many fans said it was hard to get a ticket.

;

;The fans who went to the concert wore Mayday’s exclusive logo, waved blue fluorescent sticks in their hands, and some wore black Mayday peripheral shirts. Fans can purchase peripherals online in advance or at the concert.

;

;Take light sticks as an example. A cloud-based interactive light stick costs 140 yuan, the light stick protective cover webbing is 50 yuan, and the light stick sticker is 40 yuan. During a concert, there were as many as 19 types of Mayday peripheral products, with prices ranging from 40 yuan to 1,050 yuan. If fans want to collect all peripheral products, they will need to spend a total of 5,244 yuan.

;

;Based on the number of viewers of the 8 concerts in Shanghai, the revenue from tickets and peripheral products (only counting the price of a single light stick) was at least 178 million yuan, that is, the average revenue per game started at 20 million yuan.

;

;Why should one city do multiple shows? The more tours there are at a single stop, the cost of clothing, video production, stage construction, etc. will also be diluted, and the profit margin will be larger.

;

;According to statistics from Southern Weekend reporters, in 2023, Mayday’s dual-theme switching tour will have a total of 68 performances, covering 21 cities, including 12 mainland cities. Among the singers who held concerts this year, Mayday ranked second in terms of number of concerts, with 40-year-old Joker Xue occupying the first place with 104 official concerts. Joker Xue once canceled a concert in Chengdu due to a sudden high fever that caused tonsil discomfort.

;

;68 concerts a year, which is equivalent to a frequency of five or six concerts per month. On average, it can be said that there are concerts every week.

;

;Mayday’s role as a “model worker” in concerts did not start this year.

;

;From 2004 to 2006, Mayday held the "Final Home When We Mix Together" world tour concert, which traveled to 11 cities around the world.

;

;The then deputy general manager of Believe Music (Beijing) Li Yixun once told the media that they held two rounds of Mayday tours with different themes from 2007 to 2008, with a total of 23 performances and attracting more than 300,000 people. Watch.

;

;2017 marks the 20th anniversary of the founding of Mayday. The youngest member among them is already forty years old, but they are more diligent than when they were young, singing almost from the beginning to the end of the year.

;

;The "LIFE Life Unlimited Company" theme concert was launched in March 2017 and lasted until January 2019, with a total of 122 concerts, an average of nearly 60 concerts per year.

;

;After only three months of rest, Mayday went to Osaka, Japan in April 2019 to hold a new theme concert "Just Rock It!!! BLUE". They held 28 concerts in Osaka, Hong Kong, Beijing, Shanghai, and Taoyuan.

;

;The new crown epidemic has forced the non-stop Mayday to stop.

;

;In May 2020, in order to stick to the "May Agreement" with music fans, Mayday teamed up with Tencent TME to hold an online concert, which was watched by more than 35 million fans online. On the last day of 2020, Mayday launched a concert with the theme "I Really Want to See You" and performed six consecutive shows in Taoyuan, Taiwan.

;

;In 2021, the world is still affected by the epidemic. This year, Mayday held 14 concerts in Taoyuan, Tainan and Kaohsiung, Taiwan. In 2022, they will also tour Las Vegas, New York, and Singapore.

;

;At the end of 2022, another new-themed "Noah's Ark 10th Anniversary Evolution Reproduction Limited Edition Concert" will start in Taoyuan. At the same time, the "I Really Want to See You" concert is also going on. This theme spans four continents, with a total of 78 performances.

;

;It can be said that after Mayday joined Believe Music, releasing records was no longer the main development path, and concerts became its main job. Concerts are held with different themes almost every year, and there are even two themed concerts in the same year, and the number of concerts has expanded from more than 20 a year to more than 60 a year.

;

;In the past five years, except for the two years affected by the epidemic, there have been more than 60 games every year, and this year it is close to 70 games.

;

;The actual controller of Believe Music was once Mayday’s manager

;

;Believe Music was founded with the intention of adopting a different business model from traditional record distribution.

;

;The profit logic of the traditional record era relies on the production and distribution of records. The better the record sells and the greater the distribution, the higher the profit. Royalties are distributed between record companies and creators. What major record stores compete for is the volume of releases.

;

;The emergence of pirated optical discs has destroyed the original mature business logic. Coupled with the impact of digital music and online downloads, the record industry has plummeted.

;

;In 2006, Believe Music founders Chen Yongzhi and Xie Zhifen recruited Mayday and Rene Liu to form a new company. Chen Yongzhi was the chief strategy officer of Rolling Stone Group at the time, and Xie Zhifen was Mayday's manager. The two established Believe Music International Co., Ltd. (referred to as Believe Music) in Taipei. According to Qichacha, the chairman is Chen Yongzhi, Wu Jieying and Xie Peiling are directors, and Hong Huizhen is the supervisor.

;

;Rolling Stone Records is a local record company in Taiwan. Li Zongsheng, Luo Dayou, Liu Rene, Zhou Huajian, Tao Zhe, Liang Jingru, Mayday, etc. are all from Rolling Stone. At present, among the artists who believe in music are old Rolling Stones, such as Li Zongsheng, Rene Liu, and Su Huilun. For a certain period of time, Rolling Stone still played the role of a trusted music record publisher.

;

; Chen Yongzhi’s intention to form a new company is also obvious. The industry’s original “record sales” model is no longer viable, and a new business model needs to be found. Looking at it today, the new model can be said to be the "fan economy", with concerts, celebrity peripherals, and audio-visual product publishing as the main sources of income.

;

;In 2007, Believe Music Culture Media (Beijing) Co., Ltd. was established. The actual controller is Xie Zhifen, accounting for 92.5% of the shares, and Chen Yongzhi 7.5%. This company is responsible for the music works managed by Believe Music in China. Matters related to the mainland area.

;

;I believe that during the music period, Mayday did not put too much energy into record production, and usually only released new albums in three to five years. Especially after 2012, Mayday mostly released adapted versions of concert selections or singles, and the focus of their work every year was on tours.

;

;Believe in Music even set up a department specifically for Mayday and Liang Jingru to serve concerts. The head of the department, Zhou Youyang, was called a "foreign man" by Mayday members. This department first became famous for planning the "Left the Surface of the Earth" concert in Mayday.

;

;According to reports from Taiwan Juheng.com, Mayday accounts for 70% of Believe Music’s annual revenue. Once Mayday does not have a film or concert that year, the revenue of Believe Music will fluctuate too much. This is also the case for Believe Music. The reason why music has never been released on the market. Taiwan Juheng.com is a professional financial website in Taiwan.

;

;"Mayday Concept Stock"

;

;In 2014, with the support of Believe Music, "Foreign Man" led the Believe Music concert production department and integrated four behind-the-scenes production companies in the industry to establish a separate company The company, called Bing Creates.

;

;The official website of Bing Creation shows that the top three shareholders are Xiangzhi Co., Ltd., Rolling Stone Mobile Co., Ltd., and Believe Music International Co., Ltd., accounting for 12.25%, 8.65%, and 7.59% respectively.

;

;Xiangzhi Co., Ltd. was funded and established by Believe Music, and the actual controller is Chen Yongzhi. Based on this calculation, I believe Music holds a total of 19.84% of Bing’s shares, making it the largest shareholder.

;

;In 2018, Bing Creation (6625-TW) was listed in Taiwan and was called a "Mayday concept stock" by investors.

;

;The 2022 financial report shows that Bing generated revenue of NT$1.088 billion. After deducting costs and expenses, the net operating profit was NT$24.91 million, and the net operating profit rate was 2%. In non-epidemic years, the operating net profit margin is approximately between 4% and 8%.

;

;In the first half of 2023, the operating net profit margin will rebound to 8%. Generally speaking, the peak season for concert activities is in the second half of the year.

;

;The main revenue generated by Bing is equipment rental, performance or event production design and hardware engineering, exhibition tickets, and sales of peripheral products for exhibitions and activities. Among the main revenue generated by Bing, performance event production design and hardware engineering revenue accounted for 97%. According to the prospectus created by Bing, the record industry is in decline, and the main source of income for record companies and singers is gradually turning to concert income.

;

;Believe Music and its group member companies are all listed as related persons created by Bing. Its operating income from Believe Music is NT$190 million, accounting for 18.31% of the total revenue.

;

;B'IN MUSIC (HK) CO. LIMITED (hereinafter referred to as "Believe Music Hong Kong Company"), which Ashin participates in as a shareholder, is a substantial related party of Bing Creation and brings 6.775 million to Bing Creation. NT$ income. Believe Music Hong Kong Company was established in 2017 by Believe Music. After October 2022, it will be jointly held by Chen Yongzhi, Xie Zhifen, and Ashin (Chen Xinhong), each accounting for 33% of the shares, and Wu Jieying 1%.

;

;Judging from the financial statements of Bing Creation in the past three years since its listing, from 2016 to 2018, the revenue was NT$790 million, NT$830 million, and NT$1.423 billion respectively, of which the proportion of revenue from Believe Music are 23%, 25.63%, and 10.1%.

;

;In addition to Mayday, Li Zongsheng, Liu Ruoying and other artists affiliated with Believe Music, Bing Creation also undertakes artist concert production projects from non-affiliated companies. According to the official website of Bing Creation, Bing Creation is the first performance service provider to be listed in Taiwan and has now become one of the largest concert production companies in the Chinese world.

;On December 3, 2023, Chongqing Children’s Hospital, parents took their children to wait for treatment ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;On December 2, 2023, the National Health Commission held a press conference to introduce the prevention and treatment of respiratory diseases in winter relevant situation. Mi Feng, spokesperson of the National Health Commission, said that at present, the National Health Commission, together with the State Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine and the State Administration of Disease Control and Prevention, continue to carry out winter respiratory disease monitoring and research and judgment, and are doing a good job in allocating medical resources, optimizing the medical treatment process, and playing a central role. Medical functions and other work are deployed.

;

;According to monitoring, the currently prevalent acute respiratory diseases are all caused by known pathogens and have corresponding mature treatments. No new infectious diseases caused by new viruses or bacteria have been found.

;

;The superimposed and high incidence of multiple pathogens makes this wave of respiratory disease infections another major test for the medical system after the COVID-19 epidemic. In addition to continuing to implement and improve the hierarchical diagnosis and treatment system and improving the general awareness of primary medical and health institutions, The old problem of long-term shortage of pediatric medical resources, including infection diagnosis and treatment capabilities and severe illness identification and referral efficiency, has once again attracted widespread attention.

;

;On December 4, the General Office of the National Health Commission issued the "Notice on Guiding Primary Medical and Health Institutions to Provide Health Services for Respiratory Diseases in Winter and Spring", which proposed requirements for pediatric diagnosis and treatment services in primary medical and health institutions. Multiple requirements: Primary medical and health institutions in various places must be fully open to children and must not refuse treatment; general hospitals should strengthen support for primary medical and health institutions; each primary medical and health institution should have at least one general practitioner to complete the diagnosis and treatment of pediatric diseases. For work training, at least two nurses must complete pediatric treatment training to speed up the improvement of grassroots capabilities in carrying out pediatric and respiratory disease diagnosis and treatment in winter and spring.

;

;;

;

;On November 29, 2023, in Shanghai, many children patients were still queuing up for treatment in the emergency department at Children's Hospital at night;(Visual China/ Picture);

;

;"Immune gap"?

;

;In November, the pediatric clinics of various hospitals in Beijing have been full. The waiting time for outpatient and emergency services at Daxing Hospital and Friendship Hospital even reached more than 24 hours. The emergency infusion center of Beijing Children’s Hospital received nearly 2,000 calls. .

;

;Dai Jia, a pediatrician at a comprehensive university hospital in Beijing, sees more than 120 patients every day. Even for night emergencies, the number of outpatient and emergency visits is two or three times that of 2019. Due to the large number of patients being treated, the department will rotate a doctor on duty in the ward to support the outpatient department every day.

;

;Beyond Beijing, the pediatric wards of hospitals in Tianjin, Liaoning, Shanghai, Guangdong and other places are also operating at full capacity. The average daily emergency department attendance at the Panyu Campus of Guangdong Maternal and Child Health Hospital has reached more than 800, exceeding the spring flu peak in Guangzhou in March 2023. The outpatient and emergency departments of Sun Yat-sen University Affiliated Hospital are fully booked, and it is common to wait in line for several hours. Dozens of inpatient beds have also been reserved, waiting to be freed up to treat children with pneumonia. But in general, hospitals in Guangzhou are much more relaxed than Beijing. At least in the waiting hall, everyone has a seat and an infusion pole.

;

;When influenza is prone to occur every spring and winter, there will be a peak period for consultations in pediatric clinics, but this year’s round of respiratory tract infections lasts particularly long. An Yang, a pediatric resident at a tertiary hospital in Guangzhou, has been working intensively for several months. “Since August and September, drug-resistant mycoplasma infections have been present, and they have eased for a while, but B and A have started again. , and may overlap, and the symptoms will be more severe."

;

;The ward managed by Anyang is in a saturated state all year round. If a child who needs hospitalization is found, the outpatient and emergency doctors will first ask if there are any children in the ward. There are no beds. If they cannot be vacated temporarily, the doctor will provide emergency infusion and symptomatic treatment. At the same time, it is recommended to consult other hospitals for bed inpatient treatment. In fact, most children who come to the outpatient and emergency department have mild symptoms assessed by doctors and can be treated with oral medications and observe the effects. For children with more severe conditions, intravenous administration may be considered. Anyang and colleagues found that one of the characteristics of this round of Mycoplasma pneumoniae is the high rate of drug resistance. "Azithromycin, commonly used in pediatric treatment, is not effective orally, and the intravenous effect is not as good as before."

;

;" Azithromycin is still used in pediatrics. Azithromycin has been used in pediatrics for a long time, and there is a lot of experience in clinical observation of drug effects and adverse reactions. If quinolones and tetracyclines are abused, the gains may outweigh the losses." Anyang said, the 2023 edition of "Children's Guide" issued by the National Health Commission In the "Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Treatment of Mycoplasma Pneumonia" (;hereinafter referred to as the "Guidelines";), in addition to the macrolide antibiotics represented by azithromycin, New tetracyclines and quinolones have also been recommended, but their side effects have been repeatedly emphasized: new tetracyclines may affect enamel development and cause yellowing of teeth, and are not recommended for children under 8 years old; quinolones may affect cartilage development and increase tendons. Risk of breakage, not recommended for use by children under 18 years of age. "Nowadays, partial drug resistance gene testing of Mycoplasma pneumoniae can be done, and the results can be obtained quickly. However, azithromycin is generally used to observe the efficacy first. If clinical drug resistance is found, the drug resistance gene test will be used to determine whether to use other antibiotics for treatment."

;

;Computational biologists at University College London said in a statement to the UK's Science Media Center that lockdown measures implemented to slow the spread of the new coronavirus have prevented the spread of seasonal pathogens and reduced people's ability to build immunity to these microorganisms. opportunity.

;

;The World Health Organization (WHO) mentioned a similar statement - the new crown epidemic may have caused an immunity gap (immunity gap). During the epidemic, the spread of other viruses and bacteria decreased sharply, which may cause some children to Lack of immune defense against influenza, respiratory syncytial virus and other viruses that cause colds. An immune gap is a deficiency in protective immunity caused by chronic low exposure to a specific pathogen, leaving a greater proportion of the population susceptible to the disease.

;

;The above statement is still controversial, and Anyang is not convinced. He believes that this is related to the popular microorganism itself. There will be a pandemic year every few years. "Maybe this year's mycoplasma is special." What he feels is special is that mycoplasma pneumonia is prone to occur in children aged 5 to 14 years old, but this year people of all ages are infected. He was also suspected of being infected before. He coughed continuously for two or three weeks and took medicine by himself for a week. , using an atomizer. He didn't have a diagnosis because he didn't have time to get tested.

;

;;

;

;On November 29, 2023, Children's Hospital Affiliated to Capital Institute of Pediatrics, children and their families waiting outside the clinic;(South People Weekly reporter Liang Chen/picture);

;

;"Big hospital superstition"

;

;Ideally, tertiary hospitals should not be the first choice for pneumonia patients. "Go to the community first." Hospitals provide oral antibiotics. Some people will recover gradually, but some people will not recover. Then they go to a large hospital and undergo outpatient treatment, and then screen out the severe patients." However, hierarchical diagnosis and treatment in pediatrics is generally more difficult, and An Yang has almost never seen patients who take antibiotics. Patients who come to see a doctor based on their community hospital visit records.

;

;"Actually, as long as you follow the guidelines, the medication is almost the same. It depends on whether they can judge the serious condition in time." As long as the judgment of the serious condition is not delayed, Anyang feels that the treatment in community hospitals is not much different from that in tertiary hospitals. "Severe symptoms are more obvious, such as low blood pressure, shortness of breath, and obvious white lesions on the chest X-ray." The severe rate of Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection is relatively low. In the Third Affiliated Hospital of Zhongshan Hospital, which is densely populated, patients are transferred to the ICU every day (;).

;

;Part of the "big hospital superstition" in pediatrics stems from the reality. Pediatrics are highly dependent on clinical experience, and their diagnosis ideas are very different from those of adults. Parents will trust hospitals with greater patient volume; secondly, large hospitals The medical resources in China are more abundant, but some grassroots hospitals have limited conditions. There are no night clinics, no tests, and no X-rays. "For more complex diseases, the local second-level hospitals will directly recommend them to us." Anyang said that over time, many people will skip the first- and second-level hospitals and go straight to the third-level hospitals.

;

;Zhu Xiaochun, chief physician of the neonatal surgery department of the Panyu Campus of Guangdong Maternal and Child Health Hospital, believes that parents’ emphasis on their children is also the reason why they choose large hospitals. Not long ago, a friend of Zhu Xiaochun's child had a high fever. He had already seen the best pediatrician in the local county hospital and called Zhu Xiaochun to consult about his condition. He was still worried and had to drive hundreds of kilometers to the Provincial Maternal and Child Health Care Center. See a doctor in the hospital. I spent thousands of dollars on metagenomic testing of pathogenic microorganisms (mNGS) and found out that I was infected with a rare mycoplasma. “It actually doesn’t mean much, it’s still a mycoplasma infection. After becoming resistant to azithromycin, I switched to tetracycline and my fever went away.” Some."

;

;Subsequently, a friend suggested that "the child's mental state is not good" and he saw the respiratory department and neurology department. The neurologist suggested that he stop taking the medicine for a few days and then consider whether to do anything based on his mental state. lumbar puncture. After my friend stopped taking the medicine for three days, he took his child to Chimelong Paradise and told Zhu Xiaochun that "the child is fine." Zhu Xiaochun summed it up: "Many times it is the parents' nervousness that causes doctors to passively over-treat. If the doctor doesn't do this, the parents will blame you."

;

;Gao Jie, a pediatric respiratory doctor, encountered Many parents ask for blood tests as soon as they arrive. She opposes excessive testing. If the patient's symptoms are very typical, she will directly provide empirical treatment to save time. But she also understands the parent's appeal, "He will feel that he has been queuing for 8 hours and needs to get checked. If he doesn't do it, he will go back. Queuing for such a long time is a sunk cost. If it were me, I would get a test As a result, I feel confident."

;

;An Yang found that the biggest feature of this round of Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection is that "parents are generally anxious", "I was very anxious before hospitalization, and rushed to be discharged after staying for two days. After a slight improvement, they are asking when they will be discharged from the hospital. The children have to go to school. They have missed classes and mid-term exams. Especially for children who have just entered elementary school or the first grade of junior high school, parents are particularly worried about the long absence from school. If you can’t keep up, it will be difficult to integrate into the class.”

;

;According to the guidelines, the treatment course for pneumonia is 7 to 14 days, but even children who are hospitalized with severe symptoms will not be able to stay for a full course of treatment due to the shortage of hospital beds. . But this does not mean that children can go to school. "In the later stages of (respiratory tract infections) diseases, the airways will be in a more sensitive stage and are easily infected by other bacteria and viruses again." Regarding this round of infection peak, Anyang In addition to public health common sense such as washing hands frequently and wearing masks, the advice also includes "don't be so anxious to go to school."

;

;;

;

;Guangdong Maternal and Child Health Hospital Panyu Campus, children using atomizers;(Southern People Weekly reporter Nie Yangxin/picture );

;

;It is normal for pediatricians to be busy

;

;The continuation of this wave of infections has put direct pressure on pediatricians on duty in outpatient and emergency departments, but for those who have just worked for three years and are still serving as For An Yang, a resident physician, the impact is not big. "The pediatric wards of tertiary hospitals are generally in full working conditions. There are no (empty) beds at any time. Either this disease or that disease, there is always one to be admitted." ."

;

;Anyang chose pediatrics for a very practical reason, "My score in the postgraduate entrance examination is not high, so I have to find a major with good employment first." The shortage of pediatricians is normal, both in large hospitals and primary hospitals. The "2015 China Health Statistics Yearbook" shows that since 2010, the total number of pediatricians in China has dropped from 105,000 to 100,000, with an average of only 0.43 pediatricians per 1,000 children, which is equivalent to the national average of 2.06 physicians per 1,000 people. They are far apart, so the conditions for admissions and employment in pediatrics are more relaxed.

;

;However, the comprehensive appeal of pediatrics is still not strong. It was not until after working that An Yang deeply understood why his brothers and sisters advised everyone not to study pediatrics. For new doctors, there are too many things to learn and memorize in pediatrics. Other doctors only need to be proficient in part of the content, while pediatrics requires further subdivisions. Moreover, children of different ages have different levels of organ growth and development and different physiological characteristics, which leads to poor diagnosis. The indicators and dosages are different. "Many drugs do not have clear dosages for children, and most of them are still used empirically."

;

;Anyang also needs to learn how to coax children from scratch, "In the beginning, talk to children When interacting with others, it was difficult to behave in a childish way, but it gradually got better. Some children prefer funny voices, so you have to explain the problem to them in a child's tone." For children who really can't listen, you can only When he was crying, An Yang saw a doctor. Now his tolerance for crying has been greatly improved. "I don't feel it if you make a fuss next to me."

;

;Sometimes the patient's cooperation will be poor. Directly affects diagnosis and treatment. Anyang would secretly perform liver and spleen palpation while the children were asleep, because when they cried, the entire abdominal wall was hard and "impossible to touch."

;

;Children will be given sedatives before doing some more complex examinations, but the examining doctor is unwilling to bear the risk of medication, so Anyang needs to accompany the child with sedatives for examinations - queuing, examination, It takes a lot of time to wait for the results, and there are other children's problems in the ward that need to be dealt with, so the working hours are extended indefinitely. Anyang only has half a day to one day off every week.

;

;In the pediatric department where Anyang works, according to the division of work responsibilities, an attending doctor only works with 1-2 resident doctors and has to manage more than a dozen beds. The shortage of staff is obvious, but the hospital has no plans to recruit people and relies entirely on the support of "regular trainees" - medical graduates with a bachelor's degree or above who are new to medical positions must undergo three years of standardized residency training. The low income of graduates during the training period is the main way for hospitals to alleviate staff shortages at low cost.

;

;Although he has not been working for a long time, Anyang has clearly understood that pediatrics cannot bring higher economic benefits to the hospital. "The hospital also has to consider revenue and expenditure, so what incentive does it have to recruit pediatricians?"

; p>;

;;

;

;Parents and children waiting to be called in the emergency waiting room at the Panyu Campus of Guangdong Maternal and Child Health Hospital;(Southern People Weekly reporter Nie Yangxin/ Picture);

;

;"If you can choose, how to choose?"

;

;"Doctors are trained and hard-working." Zhu Xiaochun has been in Guangdong Maternal and Child Health Hospital Although he is the chief physician, he is still very busy. On the afternoon of the afternoon when he was interviewed by Southern People Weekly, he read all the patients who came to register, but the interview was still interrupted by patients who wanted to add more patients. A parent took his child to the imaging department after 4 p.m. The imaging department was already doing the finishing work, and the nurse asked him to do the examination again tomorrow. After Zhu Xiaochun heard about it, he called the imaging department to coordinate, "The patient is from out of town. It is not easy to come here. It is a big help if he can help."

;

;Usually there are 36 patients in a half-day consultation. Zhu Xiaochun could add up to 45 numbers at most. "If you can see it, let others see it." The registration system was closed at 11:45 in the morning, but he continued to add numbers until 13:30. Patients who could not be registered were not counted. workload.

;

;Pediatrics is a "dumb department". Children cannot accurately describe their physiological conditions, which makes pediatric diagnosis more difficult. Doctors must be experienced and patient. Zhu Xiaochun sees several children with "stomach pain" every time he visits a doctor. The children can't tell where the pain is, so they just say it hurts everywhere. "You have to find the cause accurately. If it's a complication from surgery, you have to make a prompt decision." Otherwise, serious complications may occur. Sometimes there is a lot of reasoning involved in the diagnosis process."

;

;A child who complained of stomachache said he was beaten by two classmates. After punching him, Zhu Xiaochun first asked him to check to see if he had injured his internal organs, but no obvious problems were found. After careful questioning, I found that the child had some diarrhea. In the end, other causes were ruled out, and it was basically concluded that the stomachache was caused by diarrhea. "You can't limit yourself to his words. Sometimes it just happens."

;

;Pediatrics is periodically overcrowded with consultations every year. Internal medicine is at the peak of seasonal influenza, and surgery is during the summer vacation—every summer, urology is the place to go. Pediatric offices are crowded with surgically circumcised children. As the director of the pediatric surgery department, Zhu Xiaochun needs to balance the work intensity of the department. In 2022, he transferred an attending doctor from the cardiorenal surgery department to support the urology department. This year, he really can't find anyone. Some doctors want to go to the countryside for free clinics and have to work at the transfer center. The hospital has no new recruits, so he can only wait for himself.

;

;“There are only more than 8,000 pediatric surgeons in the country.” Zhu Xiaochun said that he believed the main reason was that pediatric treatment was so poor. In late November, he went to a free clinic in the county. The chief surgeon of a hospital said that the pediatric surgeons in his hospital were no longer willing to work. “Surgeries in small hospitals are all on the first floor, and the breast surgery is next to the pediatric surgery. Breast surgery is so easy.” , low risk, high performance. If you treat the same number of patients, pediatric surgery will be exhausted. The difference in effort is clear at a glance, but the performance is similar. If you can make a choice, how to choose?"

;

;Exploring new Solution

;

;The "pediatrics shortage" has been around for a long time. In 1998, the pediatrics major was eliminated from the undergraduate education of medical schools and replaced by the clinical medicine major. The pediatrics major was not subdivided until the graduate level. In 1999, undergraduate enrollment in pediatrics was suspended nationwide, and it was not resumed until 2016, when the “universal two-child” policy was implemented.

;

;In 2022, the National Health Commission issued an implementation plan for the implementation of the 2021-2030 Outline for the Development of Women and Children in China. The plan points out that by 2030, there will be 1.12 pediatric practicing (assistant) doctors per 1,000 children, and the number of beds will increase to 3.17.

;

;A doctor interviewed believes that in order to attract more people to choose pediatrics, the scores for the postgraduate entrance examination and practicing physician examination have been lowered. The hospital’s recruitment conditions for pediatric medical staff are also looser than those for adult departments, but in fact The effect is not good, and there is still a shortage of people in pediatrics because the crux of the problem has not been solved. “If departments like pediatrics and emergency departments, which are tired, hard-working and have little money, want to attract talents and reverse the talent gap, the most direct stimulus is to increase the investment of resources in the department and increase the income of the medical staff in the department. ”

;

;In the context of the “pediatric shortage”, the promotion of hierarchical diagnosis and treatment is particularly important to alleviate the “difficulty in pediatric medical care”. In 2015, the "Guiding Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Construction of a Hierarchical Diagnosis and Treatment System" was released, which clarified the concept of hierarchical diagnosis and treatment and proposed a model of first diagnosis at the grassroots level, two-way referral, acute and chronic treatment, and linkage between the upper and lower levels. Article 30 of the Basic Medical Care and Health Promotion Law, which came into effect in June 2020, once again emphasizes that "the state promotes the implementation of a hierarchical diagnosis and treatment system for basic medical services and guides non-emergency patients to seek treatment at primary medical and health institutions first."

;

;According to the statistical bulletin on the development of my country's health industry, in the past five years, the number of diagnoses and treatments in hospitals at all levels accounted for about 45% of the total number of diagnoses and treatments in medical and health institutions nationwide, and primary medical and health institutions accounted for about 50%, of which townships The diagnosis and treatment volume of health centers and community health service centers (;Station;) is about 24%, which is more than 80% in developed countries. The number of medical visits that occur in medical institutions outside hospitals is still far behind.

;

;In order to promote the implementation of hierarchical diagnosis and treatment, large hospitals will form a consortium of public medical institutions with grassroots hospitals. Zhu Xiaochun introduced that Guangdong Maternal and Child Health Hospital has established a medical consortium with more than 100 units to provide technical support and supplement medical resources. “We will go to villages and towns to give lectures to the specialty alliances of the medical consortium and conduct remote consultations online. , allowing patients with mild symptoms to stay at the grassroots level, and allowing patients who must be transferred to be transferred in time. After our patients are stabilized after surgery, they can also be transferred to grassroots hospitals to achieve two-way referral."

;

; General practitioner Wu Tianlong has worked at the Wenhua Community Health Service Center in Luohu District, Shenzhen (;hereinafter referred to as "social health";) for 13 years , he believes that the linkage between social health and higher-level hospitals is a benign two-way interaction. "We have the opportunity to go to higher-level hospitals for sub-specialty training, such as going to the Children's Hospital in Shenzhen for three months of off-the-job study to learn how to deal with common diseases. At the same time, we It is also the training base of Shenzhen People’s Hospital. Medical students spend the first half of the year in our community and can learn the skills of pediatric reception and many public health services.”

;

;Wenhua Community Health has 12 doctors. , both are general practitioners. Wu Tianlong feels that they can basically meet the needs of the community. "Now many community residents will first choose to see a doctor in the community health service instead of going to a big hospital. The number of outpatient clinics has increased several times compared with before." He usually sees basic medical care. Respiratory diseases are also essential skills for social health doctors. Wu Tianlong sees sixty or seventy patients a day, with an average of 8 to 10 minutes per patient. Two-thirds of them are children, and most of them are respiratory infections.

;

;Shenzhen Shekang’s hierarchical diagnosis and treatment is at the forefront of the country. During the fever peak in December 2022, Shekang’s fever clinic “carried” 65% of the diagnosis and treatment volume. In order to mobilize the enthusiasm of ordinary people to go to social health centers, Shenzhen City requires participants in the second and third tiers of basic medical insurance to select a social health center in the city as a designated medical institution for outpatient treatment, and continue to devote themselves to hospitals, public health Information collaboration between institutions and social health enables mutual recognition of test results and exchange of medical resources.

;

;The most critical thing is to “straighten out the internal interest mechanism.” Li Chuangzeng, deputy director of the Shenzhen Municipal Health Commission, concluded, “Let doctors in large hospitals have the incentive to transfer patients; doctors in social health centers have the incentive to move up. Transfer patients. Patients can finally consciously choose social health centers. There is still a long way to go to finally achieve this goal."

;

;(At the request of the interviewees, Anyang and Dai Jia are pseudonyms in the article. Thanks to Chen Yang and Zhang Mingmeng for their help in this article.)

;

;

;The high-strength steel produced by Hebei Iron and Steel Group crossed Shanhaiguan and was transported to the BMW Brilliance Shenyang factory 500 kilometers away. The stamping workshop here is stamped and formed with a force of up to 10,300 tons to become the body of the BMW car.

;

;Behind these seemingly "heavy industrial style" scenes is the support of lighter and more fashionable "green electricity" - the production of two factories inside and outside Shanhaiguan is Renewable energy electricity is used.

;

;Looking across the country, green power trading, which was officially launched two years ago, now covers the whole country and the rules are more complete. In the first three months of 2023, the national green power transaction scale has reached 25.026 billion kilowatt hours, exceeding the entire year of 2022.

;

;Southern Weekend's research found that despite the rapid growth of green electricity trading volume, the endogenous motivation of different market entities to participate in green electricity trading is still weak. At present, green power transactions are dominated by large enterprises and foreign trade companies, while small and medium-sized enterprises are still "bystanders" to green power transactions. Data also shows that the country's renewable energy power generation will reach 2.7 trillion kilowatt hours in 2022, of which green power trading volume only accounts for 0.84%.

;

;The reason is that the "Research Report on China's Green Electricity Consumption Path" released by the Energy Foundation to support the Jianheng Certification Center pointed out that the renewable energy power in most provinces The weight of consumption responsibilities is mainly completed by power grid enterprises to ensure consumption, and the assessment indicators have not yet been specifically broken down and implemented on the electricity sales companies or power users that should be assessed; the green electricity trading market has not yet effectively formed a market-based pricing mechanism, and various regions give priority to regional Green power consumption, "Only when the green power supply in the region cannot meet the consumption demand, the purchase of cheaper external green power will be considered."

;

;From this perspective, how to promote market entities of different sizes to participate in green electricity transactions in the future will be the focus of decision-makers.

;

;Zheng Ying, a special researcher at the China Carbon Neutral Fifty Forum and director of the Dual-Carbon Business Department of Beijing Electric Chain Technology, believes that when the "dual-carbon" policy is gradually advanced Under this situation, both large enterprises and small and medium-sized enterprises are facing increasing internal and external emission reduction constraints and pressures, and participating in medium and long-term green power transactions or purchasing green certificates will become important ways to reduce emissions. "In the future, dual control assessment of energy consumption and even dual control assessment of carbon emissions will become the main battlefield for the domestic application of green power/green certificates."

;

;Favor green power, and the "giants" will take the lead

; < p style="text-align: left;">;Looking at the 2021 and 2022 Chinese enterprise green power transaction rankings compiled by Bloomberg New Energy Finance, it can be found that companies active in the green power market are roughly divided into Internet companies, large state-owned enterprises and foreign companies. .

;

;Internet technology companies have always presented themselves as low-carbon and avant-garde. However, data centers, as important infrastructure of the Internet, are also large energy consumers. The most important thing is to reduce the carbon emissions of data centers. The effective way is to use green electricity. This has also made Alibaba Cloud, Tencent, Chindata and GDS become big buyers of green electricity. In 2022, Alibaba's green power transaction volume reached 860 million kilowatt hours, and Tencent's reached 504 million kilowatt hours, both entering the top five in corporate green power procurement rankings.

;

;However, even for leading Internet companies, the proportion of green electricity usage in total electricity consumption is not high. In 2020, GDS's renewable energy usage ratio was 22.6%, and this number increased to 34.3% in 2021; during fiscal year 2022, 21.6% of the electricity used by Alibaba Cloud came from clean energy.

;

;Compared to Internet companies, green electricity trading by steel companies, traditional large carbon emitters, is more urgent.

;

;Green electricity trading practitioners believe that large steel companies are often local leading companies and have always been the main targets of environmental protection supervision. They must play a role in practicing green development. Take the lead. Compared with improving processes, using green electricity is an easier and faster-effective emission reduction measure. In addition, in recent years, coal prices have been high, and thermal power prices have risen accordingly, making green power “less expensive.”

;

;What's more important is the pressure from the external market - a large part of the high-precision steel products developed by steel companies must be sold to foreign companies or exported overseas, facing meet the stringent requirements of product carbon footprint. For example, in March 2022, HBIS Group purchased 270 million kilowatt-hours of green electricity at the North Hebei Power Trading Center, partly because HBIS signed a "Memorandum of Cooperation on Building a Green Low-Carbon Steel Supply Chain" with BMW Brilliance, one of its major customers. , HBIS provides BMW with high-strength steel with a lower carbon footprint by using green electricity.

;

;Foreign companies favor green power and have chosen to sign medium- and long-term green power agreements. This is due to factors such as the lack of international recognition of domestic green certificates and the more convenient green power transactions. related.

;

;Take the German-owned enterprise BMW Brilliance as an example. In 2021, it purchased 2.78 billion kilowatt-hours of green electricity and was the "big buyer" of green electricity transactions that year. It can meet the requirements of BMW Shenyang factory to use 100% green electricity for production. Guo Junhan, manager of BMW Brilliance's business development and corporate sustainability department, said that the company's purchase and use of green electricity will eventually be summarized in the non-financial statements of the German BMW Group and go through PwC (China) and PricewaterhouseCoopers. Audited by Road (Germany) to ensure that it meets the EU’s carbon emission control requirements for car companies.

;

;The EU's green electricity trading is very different from China's. Many European audit institutions are not familiar with China's green electricity trading model, making the entire audit process relatively lengthy. "In view of the situation and types of China's green electricity transactions, including China's green certificate, we will have regular communications with the audit institutions to inform them of China's current development situation," Guo Junhan said.

;

;How to "prioritize" green electricity

;

;Compared with large enterprises that are the vanguard of emission reduction, the products of domestic export-oriented enterprises and foreign enterprises Suppliers are also feeling the pressure to reduce carbon emissions.

;

;Zhejiang Shenzhou International is one of the first companies in Zhejiang Province to participate in green electricity transactions. It is engaged in OEM processing for internationally renowned clothing brands. These clothing brands are relatively Pay attention to the carbon footprint of products and ask supply chain partners to get on board. Especially in the context of the EU's imminent imposition of "carbon tariffs", purchasing green power is an important means to maintain orders from international partners.

;

;The general manager of a Dongguan electronics company told Southern Weekend that 40% of the company's annual turnover comes from export business, and its overseas customers value the company's green electricity transactions. volume, the use of green electricity has become a bonus for the company’s exports. "Green power has a premium over thermal power. Based on cost, we determine the proportion of green power to buy. It mainly depends on how much electricity is needed to manufacture export products. The rest still uses thermal power."

;

;Song Yu, a trader of Envision Energy's environmental products, also told Southern Weekend that their customers are mainly export-oriented companies in the Yangtze River Delta and Pearl River Delta. "The main purpose of buying green power is to meet the requirements of foreign customers."

;

;However, more domestic small and medium-sized enterprises have not yet "prioritized" green power. "Whether it is total energy consumption control or the weight of renewable energy consumption responsibilities, these policies are issued by various ministries and commissions to local governments, rather than directly targeting electricity-consuming enterprises." This also makes it almost impossible for small and medium-sized enterprises to purchase green electricity. Endogenous motivation.

;

;The best way to inspire motivation is to discover business needs. For example, many small and medium-sized enterprises are concerned about whether green power purchases can be given priority or exemption from contract performance during special periods. From 2021 to 2022, many provinces in China will experience power shortages and even power rationing. Some companies asked Song Yu whether they can give priority to ensuring electricity consumption when buying green power.

;

;Four Yunnan companies that have purchased green electricity also told Southern Weekend that Yunnan, which mainly relies on hydropower, will enter a power shortage every autumn and winter dry season. According to the state, enterprises must make concessions for residents' electricity use. They have not heard that buying green electricity can avoid power restrictions. This shows that although the state and local governments encourage enterprises to participate in green electricity transactions, there is still a gap between the incentives and the expectations of enterprises.

;

;Southern Weekend found that Qinghai Province's "2023 Power Trading Plan" stipulates that for users participating in green power trading within the province, the assessment exemption for deviations in power will be appropriately relaxed According to the standard, users who use more than 30% of green electricity will be exempted from the monthly deviation assessment; Shanxi Province's "Implementation Plan for Promoting Green Consumption" proposes that when implementing orderly electricity use on the user side during periods of tight power supply, the user's historical green electricity consumption during the year will be exempted. The proportions are reversely allocated to orderly power consumption tasks.

;

;However, no similar policies have been introduced in the southeastern coastal areas where the demand for green electricity is stronger. Li Wei, an expert who works in the power system, once participated in the design of the green certificate system. She told Southern Weekend that inter-provincial green power transactions are subject to space and physical restrictions, and it is difficult for enterprises in the southeastern region, which is relatively short of electricity, to obtain priority for electricity use by purchasing green power. "For example, in Zhejiang, the amount of green electricity that can be transferred from other provinces through UHV every day is limited. For example, there are 100 million kilowatt-hours. If Zhejiang itself can generate 100 million kilowatt-hours of green electricity, then there will only be 200 million kilowatt-hours of green electricity on the market. , while supplies last."

;

;Avoid "Grasp the big and release the small"

;

;Dual control of energy consumption should have become another important starting point to promote the use of green electricity and green certificates by enterprises, but in fact the effect is also Unsatisfactory.

;

;As the main body responsible for achieving dual energy consumption control goals, the current provincial-level energy consumption authorities will bear corresponding responsibilities if they fail to complete the assessment tasks assigned by the state. When the provincial-level energy consumption authorities completed the dual energy consumption assessment requirements, they actually followed the principle of "grasping the big and letting go of the small" and decomposed the task indicators to some key energy-consuming enterprises, but "opened the door to small and medium-sized enterprises". ".

;

;In addition, Zheng Ying learned from research on some companies that many companies have not been punished even if they have not completed the dual energy consumption control requirements issued by the government.

;

;This may be because under the pressure of economic downturn, local governments must consider not only the ability of enterprises to withstand punitive measures, but also the negative impact on investment promotion. Under the dual energy consumption control requirements, it is still unclear to what extent the willingness of enterprises to purchase green certificates and green electricity will increase.

;

;"I think that when the time comes, we still need to consider forming a punishment mechanism for companies that fail to complete their targets, otherwise the green certificate/green electricity trading will be active The degree of improvement may still be limited. After all, at the current development stage of the green certificate market, if we want to enhance the willingness and motivation of enterprises to purchase on a large scale, we still need stronger policy guidance and constraints, rather than relying solely on independent and voluntary purchases by enterprises." Zheng Ying analyzed.

;

;The good news is that the "14th Five-Year Plan" has proposed to gradually transform from dual control of energy consumption to dual control of carbon emissions. By then, companies can achieve carbon emission standards by purchasing green electricity and other methods if the carbon indicators are insufficient. Before this change occurs, the dual energy consumption control system should improve its assessment indicator distribution, reward and punishment mechanism, and lay a solid foundation for the debut of dual carbon emission control, which is the proper meaning of the title.

;

;The linkage between green power, green certificates and the carbon market is imminent

;

;If green power can offset CCER (nationally certified voluntary emission reductions), It will undoubtedly greatly enhance the motivation of enterprises to purchase green electricity. "Many of our customers are concerned about whether the green certificate they bought can be used in carbon trading in the future to offset part of the carbon emissions." said the person in charge of a Tianjin electricity sales company.

;

;In fact, green power is the participant in carbon trading that can most accurately measure and verify. The green certificate records all attribute information of green power, which is natural and Accurate carbon emission reduction measurement methods are naturally connected with the carbon trading system represented by CCER. However, "electricity-carbon linkage" seems to be a matter of course, but in fact there are many difficulties.

;

;In August 2023, the National Development and Reform Commission and three other ministries and commissions jointly issued the "Notice on Full Coverage of Renewable Energy Green Power Certificates to Promote Renewable Energy Electricity Consumption" ” (hereinafter referred to as the “Notice”), emphasizes the connection between the green certificate and the carbon market. On October 24, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment formulated and released the methodology for four voluntary greenhouse gas emission reduction projects, including grid-connected solar thermal power generation and grid-connected offshore wind power generation. It also specified uniqueness and required that the projects did not participate in other greenhouse gas emission reduction transactions. mechanism, there will be no double recognition of projects or double calculation of emission reductions.

;

;In this case, whether the environmental attributes of the power generation of relevant renewable energy projects will be classified as green certificates or CCERs in the future has attracted much attention in the industry. Zheng Ying said that the "Notice" makes it clear that the green certificate is the only proof of the environmental attributes of my country's renewable energy power and the only certificate for identifying the production and consumption of renewable energy power. If the environmental attributes of renewable energy can be recognized by both Green Certificate and CCER, it will cause the environmental attributes to be repeatedly developed and calculated in the two mechanisms. "The worst result is that the green certificate and CCER are both restricted in international recognition."

;

;Currently, more than 300 companies including Apple, Google, TSMC, and Coca-Cola have Many well-known international companies have joined the RE100 initiative. The green certificates purchased by many domestic export-oriented companies need to be certified by RE100. However, Li Wei introduced that RE100 does not fully recognize domestic green certificates, but "conditional recognition". One of the reasons RE100 believes that "after the China Green Certificate is issued, environmental rights and interests should follow the green certificate. However, some power generation projects have also obtained environmental certificates issued by CCER, which results in double measurement and double benefits. Electricity consuming enterprises It was forced to self-certify. For example, for the electricity it purchased from the wind farm, it did not apply for any other environmental certificates except for the green certificate.”

;

;On October 18, 2023, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment announced the "Notice on Doing a Good Job in Reporting and Verifying Greenhouse Gas Emissions of Enterprises in Some Key Industries from 2023 to 2025" "It is mentioned that "Enterprises that purchase non-fossil energy electricity through market-based transactions must separately report this part of the electricity consumption and provide relevant certification materials," and stipulates that the certification materials do not include green power certificates. The document also stipulates that the emissions corresponding to non-fossil energy power purchased by enterprises will be temporarily calculated based on the average carbon emission factor of the national power grid, which means that the green power purchased by enterprises will not play a role in carbon emission accounting for the time being.

;

The only difference is that in order to prevent greenwashing, the emission reduction represented by the green certificate can only be used to reduce emissions from purchased power in Scope 2. In fact, what is shown on the current green certificate is Emission reduction."

;

;After clarifying the environmental attributes of green electricity, the problem of double counting still needs to be solved. The first is how to deal with the environmental attributes of the electricity represented by the green certificate when calculating the grid emission factor; the second is what grid emission factor should be used to calculate the purchased electricity when the consumer purchases or does not purchase the green certificate. carbon emission. How to improve the grid emission factors to ensure that the environmental attributes of the green certificate will not be reused or calculated on the power generation side or the consumer side. ;

;

;According to the above report, at present, cross-provincial and cross-regional green electricity transactions are mainly carried out through "network-to-network" and "point-to-network" transactions. ;

;For provinces and regions that rely on external power transfer, they need to comprehensively consider their own location characteristics and seek diversified energy supply solutions.

;

; Zhou Feng, director of the clean power project of the Energy Foundation, pointed out that a typical southeast coastal province represented by Zhejiang can not only deploy new high-voltage channels, but also It can strengthen cooperation with the development of renewable energy and the upstream and downstream of the new energy industry chain between government and provincial enterprises between provinces and provincial enterprises. For example, Zhejiang Tianneng Group reached a cooperation with Gansu Province Baiyedon Color Group and Golden Silk Road Fund to jointly promote the construction of a new energy industry ecosystem in Zhejiang and Gansu provinces. It is dedicated to the development and construction of the development and construction of low -carbon energy projects; the other is Beijing, on the one hand, it depends on external adjustment, but on the other hand, it is in the range of Beijing -Tianjin -Hebei regional power grids, which means that the scale of its external power adjustment depends on Beijing In order to complete the "Fourteen Five -Year Plan" green power target, the establishment of the "14th Five -Year Plan" should promote green transactions and promote green power growth from the two levels of the domain (Beijing -Tianjin -Hebei).

;

; To maximize the value of green electricity transactions between different provinces, the relevant mechanism of the power market may play a key role. The report "China Construction of the National Unified Electric Power Market System" jointly released by the International Energy Agency (IEA) and the Energy Foundation shows that regional transactions can promote the sharing of resources within a larger scale, so it can bring system toughness and help to improve the systemic toughness and help help Investment in reducing the need to reducing the installation.
